content: free sakura charm pattern @taimilktea crochet notes this pattern is in us terminology please do not sell copy or redistribute this pattern as yours feel free to sell the finished product but please reference me as the pattern designer thank you thanks for using this pattern tag me @taimilktea crochet in your posts so that i can see your creations @taimilktea crochet tester appreciation thank you to my testers for their invaluable feedback and for how wonderfully their charms were made @fuzmcrafts @d1ves crochet c0re @crochetbykaeli @agi sw @crocheted_by_catie @taimilktea crochet materials two different pink-ish coloured yarn from the range of white pink red etc usually the darker colour is the centre of the flower i e light pink centre white petals or dark pink centre light pink petals etc green yarn hook size depending on yarn weight pattern uses 8ply cotton yarn with 2 5mm hook scissors tapestry needle abbreviations single_crochet - single_crochet increase - increase chain - chain slip_stitch - slip_stitch tc - treble_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet … * n - repeat instructions n amount of times @taimilktea crochet flower make 2 start with your darker colour for the centre of the flower 1 magic_ring chain 4 this counts as the first st double_crochet chain * 9 into the magic ring slip_stitch into the 4th chain from the start 10 switch to the petal colour 2 ch3 1tc in ch1 space next chain 1 space - 2 tc next chain 1 space - 1tc ch3 sl st * 5 start of the next repeat should be in the same chain space chain 1 spaces should have alternating 2 tc and 1tc ch3 slip_stitch ch3 1 tc you can switch back to the centre colour here for a layered look or stick to the same one 3 ch3 2sc in 1st ch2 slip_stitch on the 1st chain picot 2sc chain 2 slip_stitch on 1st chain picot 2sc in next st chain 3 slip_stitch between petals in row below * 5 the chain 3 gets you to the top of the petal of the previous row the third row is worked at the top of the petal before the next chain 3 brings you down to slip_stitch in between the petals fasten_off leave long tail on one of the flowers to sew together @taimilktea crochet leaf using green yarn 1 chain 11 2 single_crochet in 3rd chain from hook half_double_crochet in next chain 2dc in next chain tc in next chain 2tc in next tc in next 2dc in next half_double_crochet in next single_crochet ch1 single_crochet in last chain 3 working on the other side of the chain half_double_crochet in the first chain 2dc in next tc in next 2tc in next tc in next 2dc in next half_double_crochet in next single_crochet in next and slip_stitch do not fasten_off make the other side of the leaf while still attached to the side you just completed 1 chain 11 2 single_crochet in 3rd chain from hook half_double_crochet in
